td.br: Grading Policy changes due to the COVID-19 school closure can be found by clicking here.
Homeless students are significantly more at risk of losing services during the COVID-19 pandemic. Click here for information and resources that will help students experiencing homelessness.

td.a: Food Help is Available for Those in Need

img.br: Wise Health Systems and the Tarrant Area Food Bank are providing food for families who are struggling to feed themselves.

td.br: Questions regarding enrollment and withdrawal procedures during COVID-19 should be addressed to the campus principals at 940-969-5000.

td.a: Paradise Teacher and Staff Appreciation Request

img.br: "Paradise Teacher and Staff Appreciation" is a Facebook Group dedicated to showing appreciation to those who educate our students. They are making a special request to show appreciation to our teachers and staff during this time. Click this article to read more information.

td.br:
Athletic equipment and uniform turn-in will be Thursday, April 30 at the HS Field House between 3-7 pm.
Athletes are expected to turn in all school-issued equipment and uniforms and will be able to have coaches retrieve their personal belongings from the locker room.
Due to COVID-19 and health concerns, this will be the one opportunity to retrieve personal belongings.

td.a: ATTN: Senior Parents-Senior Athletes Highlighted in May

img.br: The Athletic Booster Club is planning to highlight your senior athletes in May. Click on the title of this article to view an informative letter concerning this. Parent input is requested!

During these times, many may find a need for some extra mental support. There are support entities that are able to help! You can find Mental Health Resources available under both the FAMILIES and STAFF menus.

td.a: School Buildings Closed This School Year

img.br: Governor Abbot made the announcement that school buildings will remain close throughout the remainder of the school year. We will continue working remotely during this time.

td.br: You can find the past two weeks of our COVID-19 Health Message campaign under "Families" and "COVID-19 Health". You can also click on this link.
